name: Capstone: Comprehensive Security Implementation
description: Apply everything you've learned to implement comprehensive cloud security for your Journal API. This capstone covers IAM, data protection, network security, monitoring, and incident response - creating a production-ready security posture.
short_description: Secure your Journal API with IAM policies, secrets management, network controls, and automated threat detection.

learning_steps.description: Secure your Journal API across all five security domains: Identity & Access Management, Data Protection, Network Security, Security Monitoring, and Incident Response.

Implement proper identity and access controls:

• Create service accounts with minimal permissions
• Implement role-based access control (RBAC)
• Enable MFA for all administrative access
• Set up API authentication and authorization
• Remove any hardcoded credentials

□ Create dedicated service account for API
□ Define IAM roles with least privilege
□ Configure API key rotation
□ Set up conditional access policies
□ Enable audit logging for IAM changes

Protect data at rest and in transit:

• Enable encryption for database storage
• Configure TLS for all API endpoints
• Implement secrets management for credentials
• Set up backup encryption
• Classify and protect sensitive user data

□ Enable database encryption at rest
□ Configure HTTPS/TLS for API
□ Migrate secrets to secrets manager
□ Implement encrypted backups
□ Document data classification schema

Implement network isolation and controls:

• Configure VPC with public/private subnets
• Set up security groups for API and database
• Implement network ACLs
• Configure load balancer with WAF
• Set up private endpoints where available

□ Design VPC architecture with subnets
□ Configure security groups (API, DB, bastion)
□ Set up network ACLs for subnet protection
□ Configure load balancer with SSL termination
□ Document network architecture diagram

Set up comprehensive security monitoring:

• Enable audit logging for all services
• Configure log aggregation and analysis
• Create security dashboards
• Set up alerting for security events
• Implement metrics for security KPIs

□ Enable CloudWatch/Azure Monitor logging
□ Configure log retention policies
□ Create security event dashboard
□ Set up alerts for critical events
□ Define security metrics and thresholds

Prepare for security incidents:

• Enable threat detection services
• Create incident response runbooks
• Set up automated response actions
• Document escalation procedures
• Plan for incident communication

□ Enable GuardDuty/Sentinel threat detection
□ Create runbook for credential compromise
□ Set up automated isolation for threats
□ Document incident severity matrix
□ Create communication templates

Your implementation should meet these benchmarks:

✓ Zero secrets in code or environment variables
✓ Network isolation between API and database
✓ Encryption enabled everywhere (transit + rest)
✓ Monitoring functional with active alerts
✓ At least one automated response configured
✓ Complete documentation of security posture
✓ Cost under budget with monitoring alerts

Document and demonstrate:

1. Security architecture diagram
2. IAM roles and policies documentation
3. Network architecture with security controls
4. Monitoring dashboard screenshots
5. Incident response runbook
6. Security assessment report

questions.prompt: Walk me through the security architecture you implemented for your Journal API. What are the key security controls at each layer?
How would you respond to a potential credential compromise in your cloud environment?
